snippet: Because of a 1998 agreement, Marriott can buy the property under its Times Square hotel for $19.9 million, one-tenth of its current value, according to a report by the city comptroller.
abstract: Marriott Marquis in Times Square sits atop some of most valuable land in New York City but because of 1998 lease, hotel can buy the property from the city for only $19.9 million, one-tenth of its current $193 million value, new audit by city comptroller John C Liu says terms of lease could end up costing taxpayers $344.9 million in lost rent and proceeds from sale of property.
lead_paragraph: Because of a 1998 agreement, Marriott can buy the property under its Times Square hotel for $19.9 million, one-tenth of its current value, according to a report by the city comptroller.
